clues.answer: The original 802.11 Wi-Fi standard that operated at just this data rate.
clues.question: 1 Mbps

clues.answer: This Wi-Fi standard uses OFDM modulation and achieves 54 Mbps in the 5 GHz band.
clues.question: 802.11a

clues.answer: The official designation for 802.11n wireless standard released in recent years.
clues.question: Wi-Fi 4

clues.answer: The maximum number of spatial streams supported by Wi-Fi 5 (802.11ac).
clues.question: Eight

clues.answer: Wi-Fi 6 uses this new frequency band to achieve speeds approaching 10 Gigabit.
clues.question: 6 GHz

clues.answer: This obsolete encryption standard is vulnerable to replay attacks and is no longer secure.
clues.question: WEP (Wired Equivalent Privacy)

clues.answer: The cipher used by WPA2 deployed within the CCMP protocol for data encryption.
clues.question: AES (Advanced Encryption Standard)

clues.answer: WPA3's mechanism that replaces the vulnerable four-way handshake for authentication.
clues.question: SAE (Simultaneous Authentication of Equals)

clues.answer: WPA3 uses this mode of operation to replace AES CCMP for stronger encryption.
clues.question: AES GCMP (Galois Counter Mode Protocol)

clues.answer: The minimum passphrase length recommended for WPA2-PSK to resist brute force attacks.
clues.question: 14 characters

clues.answer: The minimum indoor range that a device supporting Wi-Fi standards should achieve.
clues.question: 30 meters (100 feet)

clues.answer: The virtual MAC address used to identify a Basic Service Set and its access point.
clues.question: BSSID (Basic Service Set Identifier)

clues.answer: A graphical representation of signal strength across different physical locations.
clues.question: Heat map

clues.answer: The total number of non-overlapping 20 MHz channels available in the 5 GHz band.
The wireless network area created when multiple APs with the same ESSID overlap coverage.
clues.question: Extended Service Area (ESA)

clues.answer: The standard antenna type that radiates signals equally in all directions.
clues.question: Omnidirectional antenna

clues.answer: The unit of measurement for signal strength where 0 dBm equals 1 milliwatt.
clues.question: dBm (decibel milliwatt)

clues.answer: A bar-shaped unidirectional antenna with fins used for long-distance point-to-point links.
clues.question: Yagi antenna

clues.answer: The RSSI value considered acceptable for a good wireless signal at reasonable range.
clues.question: -65 dBm

clues.answer: The signal orientation from an antenna that can be horizontal, vertical, or dual-polarized.
clues.question: Polarization

clues.answer: An unauthorized access point installed without permission on a wireless network.
clues.question: Rogue access point

clues.answer: This attack floods spoofed management frames to disconnect clients from an AP.
clues.question: Deauthentication attack

clues.answer: A malicious access point masquerading as a legitimate one with a similar SSID.
clues.question: Evil twin

clues.answer: Interference from multiple APs using overlapping channels in close proximity.
clues.question: Adjacent channel interference (ACI)

clues.answer: The recommended maximum number of clients per access point to prevent overcapacity.
clues.question: 30 clients
